meanings.definition: A muscle that draws a body part, such as a finger, arm, or toe, inward toward the median axis of the body or of an extremity.
meanings.sent1: The adductor helps move your leg closer to your body.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, the adductor muscles are engaged to bring the arms together.
meanings.sent3: The adductor muscle decided to pull the finger in for a hug.
meanings.sent4: Her adductor was like a magnet, pulling the arm towards the center.
meanings.sent5: The adductor acted like a rope, pulling the toe inward with strength.
